definitions: To expose (one's country, a group, or a person) to danger by treacherously giving information to an enemy.
To be disloyal to (a person, organization, or country) by revealing secrets or otherwise acting in a way that harms them.
To unintentionally reveal; be an unintentional sign of.
To lead astray; to deceive or delude.
examples: He was accused of trying to betray his country.
She felt betrayed by her closest friend.
His nervous laugh betrayed his anxiety.
The map betrayed them into a swamp.
